newsitem.title: GERMANY: Germany issues 7.5 bln dmk in 2-yr notes.
newsitem.headline: Germany issues 7.5 bln dmk in 2-yr notes.

text.p: The German federal government issued 7.5 billion marks of two-year 3.50 percent coupon Treasury notes at an issue price of 99.87 and above, the Bundesbank said on Wednesday.
The bond matures on Dec 18, 1998 and the first interest payment will be made on Dec 18, 1997, said the Bundesbank, which is the issuing agent.
The settlement date is Dec 20 and the notes will be bourse-listed on December 23, the Bundesbank said.

Germany has pledged to issue two-year Treasury notes at quarterly auctions as part of a package of measures to aid the development of the domestic bond market by selling more short-term government debt.
This week's issue is the second such issue of two-year debt.
The Treasury notes have an average yield of 3.54 percent and the average weighted price was 99.92 percent, the Bundesbank said.
The Bundesbank retained 2.49 billion marks of the issue for market-tending purposes, bringing the total volume of the issue to 10 billion marks.
